S&P 500 flirted with all-time highs but ended the day nearly flat . Nasdaq Composite boosted by Nvidia’s 4% surge, which helped the chipmaker secure a record closing price . Aible empowers business teams within HPE Private Cloud AI environments running NVIDIA accelerated computing, to automatically build, coach, and deploy AI agents across on-prem, hybrid cloud, and edge scenarios . This collaboration marks Aible's official induction into the HPE Unleash AI partner program .  Enterprises will need thousands, if not millions of agents, and there are simply not enough experts that can build these agents . Clearly, business users will need to be empowered to build their own custom agents . Together, companies are providing a turnkey, enterprise-scale AI environment .  Aible agents revolutionize how business users uncover insights from both structured and unstructured data . By harnessing the power of AI, the agents automatically analyze millions of variable combinations to identify the true drivers behind business changes-what changed, andwhy .  Aible is recognized in the 2025 Gartner® "Market Guide for Agentic Analytics"* The market is in its early stages, with established analytics and business intelligence (ABI) vendors incorporating agentic capabilities into their platforms while new specialized players emerge with purpose-built solutions .  The integrated agentic AI solution is being featured in an NVIDIA session at HPE Discover 2025 titled "AI Agents for Business Users at Enterprise Scale," on Wednesday, 6/25 at 2:30-3 PM at the NVIDIA Booth #3005 .  Aible leverages cutting-edge NVIDIA technologies to optimize end-to-end agents . Aible's platform is now optimized to run on HPE Private Cloud AI, enabling enterprises to deploy AI agents at the edge and on-premises environments .  The live event highlighted Aible's mission to make AI both accessible and impactful for everyone, across all skill levels . The Nebraska AI Agent Hackathon was shared in a session with Aible customer PrabhakarVijayarangam .  Live at HPE Discover Las Vegas: Aible Technology and Customer Stories Takes the Stage . Aible will showcase its latest technology advancements and customer success stories . The company will be featured in: Session with Aible customer and State Chief Data Officer at State of Nebraska - Office of CIO: Enterprise AI Pilots Are Easy. Scaling them isn't. Private Cloud is your Next AI Power Move"  Aible will be featuring its AI agent platform live at HPE Discover 2025 in Las Vegas . Sessions deliver hands-on and practical insight into how business users-without data science backgrounds-are creating, deploying, and scaling AI agents .  Aible is redefining how enterprises drive measurable business impact with specialized AI agents . CVS Health, Baptist Health, State of Nebraska, Verizon and others use AI agents from Aible to deliver measurable results across the country .  The agentic AI platform is the fastest way for business users to automatically look across millions of patterns to surface enterprise insights . Uniquely, Aible gives business users full control of the AI agents by enabling them to provide feedback on the reasoning steps to drive higher accuracy .

The next disruptive bet on humanity’s fate is moving into the realm of science fiction: Humanoid robots, UFOs and quantum computing . Over the past few months, issuers including Roundhill Investments, . have issued tech-related ETFs .  KraneShares and Themes have designed products aiming to capture these out-of-this-world ideas . It's the kind of thematic-investing pitch popularized by Cathie Wood’s ARK Investment Management .  Morgan Stanley sees the humanoid sector ballooning into a $5 trillion market by 2050 . In early June, KraneShares launched KOID — a fund targeting companies behind people-like robots . Roundhill, meanwhile, is preparing a competing humanoid ETF .  KOID tracks a rules-based index . The fund’s largest holdings include Jabil Inc., Lynas Rare Earths Ltd., Amphenol Corp. and Melexis .  Quantum computing is a functioning — albeit nascent — sector, with a Defiance product, QTUM, already pulling in more than $600 million in flows this year . Critics argue that some of these investment areas are yet undeveloped and might not catch on with investors .  The $11 trillion ETF landscape remains ever-competitive in the US, now flooded with more than 4,200 products . 40, according to Bloomberg data, are having a difficult time attracting cash .  Metaverse — a pandemic-era supertrend — offers a cautionary tale . It promised an immersive virtual future and drew in some of the world’s biggest brands . Facebook even changed its name to Meta Platforms Inc. to stake its claim .  Technology themes can offer early exposure to disruptive trends, analysts say . But very few themes have that level of success and some never fully materialize, they say .

The Agentic AI Marketis projected to grow fromUSD 13.81 billionin 2025 toUSD 140.80 billionby 2032, at a substantial CAGR of 39.3% over the forecast period . Segments covered Offering, Agent Role, Technology, Application, End User, and Region .  The Agentic AI Market is transforming rapidly as enterprises move beyond traditional automation toward goal-directed, adaptive systems capable of reasoning, planning, and decision-making . One of the most significant trends is the rise of orchestration frameworks that allow developers to build multi-agent systems with memory, tool use, and long-horizon task execution .  Large language models are now being enhanced with planning and execution layers, giving rise to agents that can generate content and operate within enterprise systems . Physical deployments of embodied agents are gaining traction in logistics, healthcare, and field operations . Enterprises also prioritize agent observability, governance, and safety as these systems become more autonomous .  IT support & service management will be the largest segment by agent role in 2025 due to the high volume, repeatability, and complexity of tasks well suited for autonomous handling . Enterprises increasingly deploy agentic AI to automate incident triage, ticket routing, root cause analysis, and infrastructure provisioning .  IT support and service management is the leading agent role segment by market share . Professional service providers to register the fastest growth rate during the forecast period, driven by rising agentic AI deployment across research, analysis, and client interaction .  The legal, consulting, auditing, and financial advisory industries involve extensive research, document generation, analysis, and client communication . Firms using agentic systems can deliver faster turnaround, 24/7 availability, and scalable solutions without increasing staff .  Asia Pacific is projected to be the fastest-growing region in the Agentic AI Market due to strong government backing, rapid digital infrastructure expansion, and rising enterprise automation demand across diverse industries . China,India,South Korea,Japan, andSingaporeactively invest in AI through national programs focused on smart cities, manufacturing modernization, and AI-led public service delivery .  Retail, banking, and telecom use agentic AI for intelligent customer engagement, automated onboarding, and supply chain optimization . adoption of cloud-native platforms and proliferation of mobile-first enterprise workflows are creating a favorable environment for deploying both computational and robotic agents on a scale . The cost sensitivity of many Asian markets is also accelerating the adoption of autonomous agents . Collaboration will allow Grip customers to automate content production at scale while maintaining brand integrity and upholding responsible AI standards . As generative AI continues to gain traction, brands face increasing pressure to ensure their outputs are legally compliant, responsibly sourced, and high-fidelity visuals that are campaign-ready .  Bria's AI models deliver the performance needed for complex content workflows . Grip's customers, such as global CPG brands like Diageo and Beiersdorf, use the AI to meet the scalability requirements of enterprise marketing teams .  Bria developed a patented attribution engine that bridges the generative output and the training dataset . Data owners are programmatically compensated according to their overall influence on each generated output . This Spotify-inspired commercial model ensures no copyright or privacy infringement .  Grip is a visual content configuration engine powered by NVIDIA Omniverse that makes it possible for large enterprises to use AI at scale . It breaks existing content down into configurable modules, allowing brands to swap out any element . Grip integrates with existing workflows to automate product swaps and generate endless, hero-quality content variations .  Bria's pre-built pipelines offer the fastest path to market-ready visual AI implementation . Leading advertising, gaming, media, and retail enterprises rely on Bria to deliver precise, on-brand visual content at scale .  Grip partners with Bria to empower brands with scalable-responsibly-sourced AI visuals at scale . Bria.ai is a platform where visual AI, data ownership, and artistic contribution coexist to create sustainable value . Grip, Grip and Bria are partners with Grip .

Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is a semiconductor giant in its own right, though the company has been left in the dust by rival Nvidia’s (NVDA) explosive rise in the artificial intelligence (AI) era . AMD has shown some remarkable strength lately, with the chip stock up 9.5% in the past 5 days following multiple positive catalysts and analyst upgrades . Melius Research on Monday upgraded AMD to "Buy" with a $175 price target . CFRA Research raised the semiconductor stock to "Strong Buy" on Tuesday .  AMD’s Q1 performance exceeded expectations, reporting revenue of $7.44 billion . The data center segment has emerged as a particular bright spot, with a 57% year-over-year increase in revenue to $3.7 billion . Analysts predict the company's earnings per share could exceed $8 within two years .  AMD stock has performed well, up 14.6% year-to-date to outperform the S&P 500 Index’s ($SPX) gain . The semiconductor industry outlook remains positive, with projections indicating an expansion from $452 billion in 2021 to $803 billion by 2028 . AMD's valuation appears reasonable compared to peers, suggesting potential upside remains .  AMD stock’s Relative Strength Index (RSI) is in overbought territory, at 76.05 - suggesting the shares may be due to consolidate some gains in the short term .

Micron Technology, Inc. will report fiscal third-quarter earnings after the closing bell on Wednesday . Micron is expected to report earnings per share of $1.59 in the fiscal third quarter, a substantial increase from $0.62 in the same quarter last year .  Revenues are estimated to reach $8.84 billion in the fiscal third quarter, up 29.7% from last year’s sales of $6.81 billion . With the rise of AI, the demand for graphics processing units (GPUs) has grown because they can handle multiple tasks more efficiently . NVIDIA Corp. has selected Micron's HBM for its upcoming GB200 and GB300 Blackwell systems .  Micron expects the data center HBM market to grow to $35 billion this year, reaching $100 billion by 2030 . The company confirmed that it has sold out its entire HBM capacity for this year and is negotiating new contracts for next year . Micron stands to benefit from the growing demand for DRAM in AI smartphones and PCs . The high demand for HBM has allowed Micron to increase its pricing by 11% in 2025 .  Brokers are somewhat positive about Micron’s prospects, increasing the average short-term price target for MU to $127.07 (up 2.8%) from $123.60 . The highest target is $172, indicating a potential 39.2% upside .
